Package com.github.dsvalerian.chip8

Interface CPUState

All Known Implementing Classes:
Chip8CPUState
public interface CPUState
Representation of the CPU state. Keeps track of all memory, registers, counters, delays, etc, and include read and set methods for each.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    popStack()
    Set the SP register back and pop the value off the top.
    void
    pushStack(int value)
    Push a value to the top of the stack and move the SP register up.

    Read the value stored in the I register.

    Set the value stored in the PC register.

    Read the value stored in the Vx register, where x is the provided register number 0-15 inclusive.

  • Method Details

    • readMemory

      int readMemory(int address)
      Read the value at an address in main memory.
      Parameters:
      address - The address to read.
      Returns:
      The value at the address.

    • setMemory

      void setMemory(int address, int value)
      Set a value at an address in main memory.
      Parameters:
      address - The address at which to set the value.
      value - The value to set.

    • popStack

      int popStack()
      Set the SP register back and pop the value off the top.
      Returns:
      The popped value.

    • pushStack

      void pushStack(int value)
      Push a value to the top of the stack and move the SP register up.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to push to the stack.

    • readV

      int readV(int x)
      Read the value stored in the Vx register, where x is the provided register number 0-15 inclusive.
      Parameters:
      x - The register number.
      Returns:
      The value stored in the Vx register.

    • setV

      void setV(int x, int value)
      Set the value in the Vx register, where x is the provided register number 0-15 inclusive.
      Parameters:
      x - The register number.
      value - The value to set.
